utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On the other hand, some physicists are concerned that if the super collider actually works, it will create a black hole and swallow up the Earth ending life as we know it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Psh, what a bunch of crybabies. No guts, no glory man.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (looking at an orange notice on the noticeboard)
utterance.content: Hey, check it out, the school of pharmacology is looking for volunteers.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We are testing a new medication for social anxiety, panic attacks, agoraphobia and obsessive compulsive disorder. Why would they be looking for test subjects here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, Raj. Maybe the comic book store doesn’t have a bulletin board. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Shhh! Hot girl in Sheldon’s office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s office? Is she lost?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t think so. I followed her here from the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe she’s his lawyer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well she’s free to examine my briefs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know, I’m disgusting, I should be punished. By her, oh look, I did it again.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Well, that should do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for coming by. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey buddy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Buddy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry I’m late, I’m working on a project that may take me up on the next space shuttle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you be late, I wasn’t expecting you at all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nobody ever expects me, sometimes you just look and… BAM! Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, are you going to introduce us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, alright, this is Missy, Missy this is Leonard and Rajesh and you’ve already met Howard.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: It’s nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You too, swell, also.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, how do you two know each other.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Oh, he once spent nine months with my legs wrapped around his head.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s my twin sister, she thinks she’s funny but frankly I’ve never been able to see it.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: It’s because you have no measurable sense of humour, Shelly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How exactly would one measure a sense of humour? A humourmometer?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I think you’re delightfully droll. Or as the French say, Tres Drole.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Okay, so let me see if I got this. Leonard, Howard and… I’m sorry what was your name again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So Missy, what brings you all the way from Texas?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Was it perhaps destiny, I think it was destiny.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: My friend’s getting married in Disneyland tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Destiny, thy name is Anaheim.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: And I had to drop off some papers for Shelly to sign for my dad’s estate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The papers could have been mailed, Mom just sent you here to spy on me, didn’t she.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: I guess that’s why they call you a genius.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They call me a genius because I’m a genius. Tell Mom that I currently weigh 165 pounds, and that I’m having regular bowel movements. Enjoy the wedding, goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard and Howard together
utterance.content: Woah, woah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If the wedding’s not until tomorrow, why don’t you stay with us tonight?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think so. Shelly doesn’t like company. Even as a little boy he’d send his imaginary friends home at the end of the day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They were not friends, they were imaginary colleagues.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, you’re here, we have plenty of room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No we don’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, Shelly, she’s family.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So what? I don’t issue invitations to your mother.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Well it would be nice not to have to drive out to Anaheim in rush hour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And don’t ever call me Shelly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So it’s settled. You’ll stay with us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll walk you to your car. You’re in structure 3 level C, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: So anyway, we’re eight years old, and Sheldon converts my easy-bake oven to some kind of high-powered furnace.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hee-hee, just classic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I needed a place to fire ceramic semi-conductor substrates for home-made integrated circuits.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: He was trying to build some kind of armed robot to keep me out of his room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Made necessary by her insistence on going into my room.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Anyway, I go to make those little corn muffins they give you, there’s a big flash, next thing you know my eyebrows are gone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ha-ha, not your eyebrows?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Yep. I had to go through the entire second grade with crooked eyebrows my Mom drew on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that what that was? I just assumed that the second grade curriculum had rendered you quizzical.

utterance.speaker: Penny (knocking and entering, holding up a pair of superman undershorts.)
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, you left your underwear in the dryer downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Those are not mine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, they have your little name label in them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I do, I use those… uh… just to polish up my… spear-fishing equipment. I spear fish. When I’m not crossbow hunting, I spear fish. Uh, Penny, this is Sheldon’s twin sister, Missy. Missy, this is our neighbour Penny.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, you don’t look that much alike.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can I get a hallelujah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fraternal twins come from two separate eggs, they are no more alike than any other siblings.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hallelujah.

utterance.speaker: Raj (running in)
utterance.content: Hey, guess what. I’ve been accepted as a test subject for a new miracle drug to overcome pathological shyness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, good for you, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, I’m very hopeful. Hello Missy. They mentioned there may be side effects.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, Missy. Have you ever met a man from the exotic subcontinent of India?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Well, there’s Dr Patel at our church.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah yes, Dr Patel, good man.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you like motorcycles, ‘cos I ride a hog.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A hog? You have a two cylinder scooter with a basket on the front.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You still have to wear a helmet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Have you ever heard of the Kama Sutra?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: The sex book?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The Indian sex book. In other words if you wonder wonder who wrote the book of love, it was us.

utterance.speaker: Penny (to Leonard)
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon’s sister’s pretty cute, I w….

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wasn’t staring!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t say you were, I just said she was cute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Huh, um, maybe, if you like women who are tall… and perfect.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, why are you ignoring your sister?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not ignoring my sister. I’m ignoring all of you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I brought snacks.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Oh my! Gherkins and….

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Onion dip, it’s onion dip.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We don’t entertain much.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Missy, do you enjoy pajamas?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We Indians invented them. You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well my people invented circumcision. You’re welcome!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Missy, I’m going to go get my nails done. Do you want to come?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: God yes. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Bye guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bye Missy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bye Missy, see you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Goodbye Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, no, uh, bye Penny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, you two have to back off.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why should I back off, you back off dude.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, this is my apartment and she’s my roommate’s sister.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So what, you’ve already got Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How do I have Penny? In what universe do I have Penny?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So I can have Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hell, no!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, can I interject something. I’m ordering pizza online, is everyone okay with pepperoni?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, can I talk to you in private?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I guess. Don’t worry, I was going to order you cheeseless.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s okay. Lactose intolerance is nothing to be embarrassed about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m a fancy Indian man, we invented pajamas!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, look at me, I don’t have a foreskin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, are you aware that your sister is an incredibly attractive woman?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmmm? She certainly has the symmetry and low body fat that western culture deems desirable. It’s noteworth that at other points in history, heavier women were the standard for beauty because their girth suggested affluence.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s fascinating, but I…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t say it was fascinating, I said it was noteworthy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright, noted. But my point is that Koothrappali and Wolowitz… they’re hitting on your sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. You know, I don’t want to criticise your rhetorical style but, we’d be a lot further along in this conversation if you’d begun with that thought.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s great, but I….

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What I’m saying is that we took quite an unnecessary detour from what I now understand to be your thesis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whatever. You have to do something about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because she’s your sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Yes, we shared a uterus for nine months, but since then we’ve pretty much gone our own separate ways.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh…. oh, consider this. With your father gone, it is your responsibility to make sure that Missy chooses a suitable mate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hadn’t considered that. We do share DNA.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So there is the possibility, however remote, that resting in her loins is the potential for another individual as remarkable as myself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly. And, you owe it to yourself and to posterity to protect the genetic integrity of your sister’s future offspring.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. If someone wants to get at Missy’s fallopian tubes, they’ll have to go through me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I am Shiva the destroyer, I will have the woman!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m warning you, I was judo champion at math camp.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright, that’s enough juvenile squabbling, stop it, stop it I say. I’m going to settle this right now. Neither of you are good enough for my sister.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who are you to decide that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s the man of his family, you have to respect his wishes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re out too, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Say what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s nothing personal, I’d just prefer if my future niece or nephew didn’t become flatulent every time they eat an Eskimo pie.

utterance.speaker: Howard (to Raj, who is smiling)
utterance.content: What are you so happy about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not happy, it’s the medication, I can’t stop smiling.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now that Leonard’s made me aware of how high the genetic stakes are, we have to face the fact that none of you are suitable mates for my sister.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Leonard made you aware of that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We all make mistakes, let’s move on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me, but I think you’re missing a big opportunity here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Everybody knows genetic diversity produces the strongest offspring. Why not put a little mocha in the family latte.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In principle you have a point, but as a practical matter, need I remind you that it takes experimental pharmaceuticals to simply enable you to speak to the opposite sex.

utterance.speaker: Raj (waving finger at him)
utterance.content: I think you’re focussing entirely too much on the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is it ‘cause I’m Jewish, ‘cause I’d kill my Rabbi with a porkchop to be with your sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This has nothing to do with religion. This has to do with the fact that you’re a tiny, tiny man who still lives with his mother.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are really being unreasonable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Am I? Here. Eat this cheese without farting and you can sleep with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Missy (who has just entered)
utterance.content: Oh really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Shelly, can I speak to you for a minute? Alone?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why does everyone suddenly want to talk to me alone? Usually nobody wants to be alone with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to Penny who is standing next to him grinning)
utterance.content: We all make mistakes, let’s move on.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Okay. I’m not even going to ask why you’re pimping me out for cheese. But since when do you care at all about who I sleep with?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Truthfully, I’ve never given it any thought, but it has been pointed out to me that you carry DNA of great potential.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: What on earth are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me explain. You see, I’m a superior genetic mutation, an improvement on the existing mediocre stock.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: And what do you mean, mediocre stock?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That would be you. But residing within you is the potential for another me. Perhaps even taller, smarter and less prone to freckling, a Sheldon 2.0 if you will.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Sheldon 2.0?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Exactly. Now, I am not saying that I should be the sole decider of who you mate with. If you’re not attracted to the suitor then the likelihood of conception would be reduced.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: You have got to be kidding me!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not at all. Frequent coitus dramatically increases the odds of fertiliziation.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Okay Shelly, sit down. Now I’ve lived my whole life dealing with the fact that my twin brother is, as Mom puts it, one of God’s special little people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I always thought I was more like a cuckoo bird. You know, a superior creature whose egg is placed in the nest of ordinary birds. Of course the newly hatched cuckoo eats all the food, leaving the ordinary siblings to starve to death. Luckily for you, that’s where the metaphor ended.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: I thought it ended at cuckoo. Now you listen to me, if you want to start acting like a brother who cares about me, then terrific. Bring it on. But you try one time to tell me who I should be sleeping with, and you and I are going to go round and round the way we did when we were little. Remember?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have an alternate proposal.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You donate eggs. We will place them in cryogenic storage. I will find an appropriate sperm donor for your eggs, have them fertilized and implanted in you, that way everybody wins.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Correction. Missy can date whoever she wants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, we have to settle this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I agree. Sheldon’s sister is hiding at Penny’s because we’ve all been hitting on her at the same time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She’s not hiding. She needed privacy to call her grandmother who’s apparently very sick. Oh, and then I believe she has to wash her hair.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, you poor, deluded bastard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t start with me dude.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You want to go again? Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If we’re going to fight over Missy, let’s do it the right way. The honourable way.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And he’s down!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, come on, get up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stay down, bitch. Yeah, ha ha, natural selection at work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I weep for humanity.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me while I go tell Missy the good news.

utterance.speaker: Penny (answering)
utterance.content: Ah, hey Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi Penny, how’s it going. Listen, that guy Mike that you were dating, is that still going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, pretty much, why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing, just catching up. By the way, may I speak to Missy please?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Hi, Leonard, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, since you’re leaving tomorrow I was wondering if you’d like to go out to dinner with me?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: That’s so sweet. But no thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. You have other plans, or…?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Alright uh… enjoy the rest of your evening.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Thanks. See you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (returning)
utterance.content: Um, here’s something we didn’t anticipate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you want, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m fine, thanks for asking. I’ve come to call on Missy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Missy?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Hi Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The amazing Howard. Do you like magic?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Not really. No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then you are in for a treat. Behold, an ordinary cane. Da-dah!

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Missy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. I apprec…. apprec…. appreeee…. oh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, honey, is your medication wearing off?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Oh, hi, cutie pie. I was hoping you’d show up.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: We had a dog who made a noise like that. Had to put him down.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Any news you want me to pass along to Mom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, she might be interested to know that I have refocused my research from bosonic string theory to heteronic string theory.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll just tell her you said hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, well, it was pleasant seeing you, other than that business with my testicles.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Come on, Shelly. I want you to know I’m very proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Yup, I’m always bragging to my friends about my brother the rocket scientist.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You tell people I’m a rocket scientist?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Well yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m a theoretical physicist.

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Missy
utterance.content: Goodbye Shelly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My God! Why don’t you just tell them I’m a toll taker at the Golden Gate Bridge? Rocket scientist, how humiliating.
